sen.j: 大映株式会社（だいえいかぶしきがいしゃ）は、1942年から2002年まで存在した映画会社。
sen.e: Daiei Motion Picture Company is a film company that operated from 1942 to 2002.
Daiei Motion Picture Company is a film company that operated from 1942 to 2002.
Daiei Motion Picture Company refers to a film company that operated from 1942 to 2002.
sen.cmt: trans2では"OK"となっておりますが、指示書に従い、"is"を"refers to"に変更しました。

sen.j: 「大日本映画製作株式会社」の略。
sen.e: The name Daiei is the shorted form of Dainippon Eiga Seisaku Kaisha.
The name Daiei is a shortened form of Dainippon Eiga Seisaku Kaisha.
The name Daiei was a shortened form of Dainippon Eiga Seisaku Kaisha.
sen.cmt: 「大映」は現在存在しないので、過去形に変更しました。

sen.j: 現･角川映画 (企業)の前身。
sen.e: It is the predecessor of the present-day Kadokawa Pictures.
It is the predecessor of present-day Kadokawa Pictures.
It was the predecessor of present-day Kadokawa Pictures.
sen.cmt: 「大映」は現在存在しないので、過去形に変更しました。

sen.j: 会社自体は大手の中では後発だが、戦前の日活の製作機構を主に引き継いでいる（発足時に合併で得た新興＝帝キネの製作部門は戦後に分離し東映の母体となる）ため伝統ある老舗として語られることが多い。
sen.e: Although a late starter among the leading motion picture companies of Japan, Daiei is regarded a respected, longstanding company because it had inherited Nikkatsu Corporation's prewar film-making organization (with production division of Shinko Cinema, formerly Teikoku Cinema, split in the postwar period to become Toei Company).

Although a late starter among the leading motion picture companies in Japan, Daiei is regarded a respected, longstanding company because it inherited Nikkatsu Corporation's prewar film-making organization including the production division of Shinko Cinema (formerly known as the Teikoku Cinema), and was split in the postwar period to become Toei Company.

Although a late starter among the leading motion picture companies in Japan, Daiei was regarded a respected, longstanding company because it mainly inherited Nikkatsu Corporation's prewar film-making organization including the production division of Shinko Cinema (formerly known as the Teikoku Cinema) which was merged at the time of establishment and was split in the postwar period to become a parent organization of Toei Company, Ltd.
sen.cmt: 「大映」は現在存在しないので、過去形に変更しました。また、「発足時に合併で得た」の訳が抜けていたので、補い、「新興＝帝キネの製作部門が戦後に分離して、東映の母体となった」ので、関係代名詞でつなげました。さらに、「母体」の訳が抜けていたので、補い、用語集等を参照し、「東映」の表記を変更しました。

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 戦時統合
sen.e: Wartime integration
Wartime integration
Wartime integration

sen.j: 1942年、戦時統制により、小規模な会社を整理・統合する戦時企業統合が、あらゆる産業分野で進められた。
sen.e: Under the wartime government program to rationalize and consolidate small business enterprises, business integration took place in all industries.
Under the wartime government program to rationalize and consolidate small business enterprises, business integration took place in all industries.
In 1942, under the wartime government program to rationalize and consolidate small business enterprises, business integration took place in all industries.
sen.cmt: 「1942年」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: 映画業界でも新興キネマ、大都映画、日活の製作部門が合併して「大日本映画製作株式会社」となる。
sen.e: The motion picture industry was no exception, with film production Shinko Cinema, Daito Eiga and Nikkatsu being merged into Dainippon Eiga Seisaku Kaisha.
The motion picture industry was no exception, with film production at Shinko Cinema, Daito Eiga and Nikkatsu being merged into Dainippon Eiga Seisaku Kaisha.
The motion picture industry was no exception, with film production at Shinko Cinema, Daito Eiga and Nikkatsu being merged into 'Dainippon Eiga Seisaku Kaisha.'
sen.cmt: 「大日本映画製作株式会社」をシングル・クォーテーションでくくりました。

sen.j: 当初の案では、映画会社は松竹と東宝の2社のみとすることになっていた。
sen.e: The merger plan was initially for consolidation into Shochiku and Toho only. However, Masaichi NAGATA, the president of Shinko Cinema's Kyoto studio, lobbied successfully to revise the consolidation plan into 3 companies.
The merger plan was initially for the consolidation of Shochiku and Toho only.
The merger plan was initially for the consolidation of Shochiku and Toho only.

sen.j: 新興キネマ京都撮影所長だった永田雅一の尽力で、統合案は3社に変更された
sen.e: However, Masaichi NAGATA, the president of Shinko Cinema's Kyoto studio, lobbied successfully to revise the consolidation plan into one involving three companies.
However, Masaichi NAGATA, the president of Shinko Cinema's Kyoto studio, lobbied successfully to revise the consolidation plan into one involving three companies.

sen.j: もともと、新興キネマは松竹の傍系会社であった。
sen.e: Shinko Cinema had originally been an affiliate of Shochiku.
Shinko Cinema had originally been an affiliate of Shochiku.
Shinko Cinema had originally been an affiliate of Shochiku.

sen.j: それにもかかわらず、同社を軸として大映は成立した。
sen.e: In spite of this, it became the foundation for establishment of Daiei.
In spite of this it became the foundation for the establishment of Daiei.
In spite of this, it became the foundation for the establishment of Daiei.
sen.cmt: In spite of this の後のカンマが削除されておりますが、辞書を検索し、カンマを再び挿入しました。

sen.j: この尽力について、立案をした情報局第五部第二課長に、贈賄をしたという黒い噂は、60年以上たった現在でも消えていない。
sen.e: Regarding this action, rumors persist to this day, more than 60 years later, that the head of Section 2, Department No. 5, of the Intelligence Bureau that had been responsible for the plan, had been bribed.
sen.cmt: 情報局第五部第二課長: Head of Section 2, Department No. 5, Intelligence Bureau （試訳）
sen.e: Rumors persist to this day, more than sixty years later, that the head of Section 2, Department No. 5, of the Intelligence Bureau that had been responsible for the plan was bribed.
Rumors persist to this day, more than sixty years later, that the head of Section 2, Department No. 5, of the Intelligence Bureau that had been responsible for the plan was bribed for the efforts.
sen.cmt: 「この尽力について」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: ただし、情報局へ、政府の「統制会社」としての大映の立場をアピールした点は、永田の勘が的中した結果でもある。
sen.e: However, it can also be interpreted as the product of Nagata's accurate decision to promote Daiei to the Intelligence Bureau to become a government-consolidated company.
However, it can also be interpreted as a result of Nagata's decision to promote Daiei to the Intelligence Bureau in order for it to become a government-consolidated company.
However, it can also be interpreted as a result of Nagata's decision to promote Daiei to the Intelligence Bureau in order for it to become a government-consolidated company.

sen.j: 業界からの密告により、収賄の疑いで永田は逮捕、拘禁されている。
sen.e: Nagata is arrested and detailed on suspicion of corruption, prompted by tips from industry insiders.
Nagata was arrested on suspicion of corruption, prompted by tips from industry insiders.
Nagata was arrested and detained on suspicion of corruption, prompted by tips from industry insiders.
sen.cmt: 「拘禁」に当る英訳がミススペルのため、削除されていたので、補いました。

sen.j: ただし、大映の社史にも、この件と噂は隠さず記録している。
sen.e: It must be noted that this fact and the rumor of bribery are recorded openly in Daiei's corporate history.
It must be noted that this fact and the rumors of bribery are recorded openly in Daiei's corporate history.
It must be noted that this fact and the rumors of bribery are recorded openly in Daiei's corporate history.

sen.j: 日活の京都にあった太秦撮影所、調布にあった多摩川撮影所（現・角川大映撮影所）と新興キネマの京都太秦撮影所（現・東映京都撮影所）、大泉撮影所（間もなく閉鎖。現・東映東京撮影所）、巣鴨の大都映画撮影所（間もなく閉鎖）、ならびに3社のスタッフ・俳優を引き継ぎ、映画制作を開始。
sen.e: The company started up by taking over Nikkatsu's Uzumasa Movie Studio in Kyoto and Tamagawa Movie Studio (presently Kadokawa Daiei Film Studio) in Chofu, Shinko Cinema's Kyoto Uzumasa Movie Studio (presently, Toei Kyoto Movie Studios) and Oizumi Movie Studio (closed shortly afterward; presently, Toei Movie Studio) and Daito Eiga Studio in Sugamo (closed shortly afterward), along with the production staffs and actors of the three companies.

The company began with the taking over of Nikkatsu's Uzumasa Movie Studio in Kyoto, Tamagawa Movie Studio (presently Kadokawa Daiei Film Studio) in Chofu, Shinko Cinema's Kyoto Uzumasa Movie Studio (presently Toei Kyoto Movie Studios), Oizumi Movie Studio (closed shortly afterwards, currently Toei Movie Studio) and Daito Eiga Studio in Sugamo (closed shortly afterwards), along with the production staff and actors of the three companies.

The company began with the taking over of Nikkatsu's Uzumasa Movie Studio in Kyoto, Tamagawa Movie Studio (presently Kadokawa Daiei Film Studio) in Chofu, Shinko Cinema's Kyoto Uzumasa Movie Studio (presently Toei Kyoto Movie Studios), Oizumi Movie Studio (closed shortly afterwards, currently Toei Tokyo Movie Studio) and Daito Eiga Studio in Sugamo (closed shortly afterwards), along with the production staff and actors of the three companies.
sen.cmt: 「東映東京撮影所」の「東京」が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: 1943年、初代社長に菊池寛が就任。
sen.e: Kan KIKUCHI assumed the office of Daiei's first president in 1943.
Kan KIKUCHI assumed the position of Daiei's first president in 1943.
In 1943, Kan KIKUCHI assumed the position of Daiei's first president.
sen.cmt: 下記「1946年、専務の永田雅一が副社長に昇格。」の表記に合わせ、年号を文頭に置きました。

sen.j: 当初の社名クレジット表記は大映マークにかぶさるように旧社名が縦表記でズームしながらクレジットされた。
sen.e: Initially, the company name shown in the opening credits had the names of the predecessors shown vertically to overlap with the Daiei logo.
Initially the company name shown in the opening credits had the names of the former companies listed vertically and overlapping the Daiei logo.
Initially the company name shown in the opening credits had the names of the former companies listed vertically and overlapping the Daiei logo.

sen.j: 1945年、社名を「大映株式会社」に改める。
sen.e: The company was renamed Daiei Motion Pictures in 1945.
The company was renamed Daiei Motion Pictures in 1945.
In 1945, the company was renamed Daiei Motion Pictures.
sen.cmt: 下記「1946年、専務の永田雅一が副社長に昇格。」の表記に合わせ、年号を文頭に置きました。

sen.j: 1947年、独占禁止法の趣旨に基づき、日活との関係が無くなる。
sen.e: In 1947, its ties with Nikkatsu were severed under the provisions of the Anti-Monopoly Law.
In 1947, its ties with Nikkatsu were severed under the provisions of the Anti-Monopoly Law.
In 1947, its ties with Nikkatsu were severed under the provisions of the Anti-Monopoly Law.

sen.j: 以降、大映は純然たる民間映画会社として存続する（他の「統制会社」が敗戦で解散した中では、珍しいケースである）。
sen.e: From this point in time, Daiei operated as a purely private company (a rare case among other "government-integrated" companies that were dissolved after Japan's defeat).
From this point in time Daiei operated as a purely private company, a rare case among the government-integrated companies that were dissolved after Japan's defeat.
From this point in time Daiei operated as a purely private company, a rare case among the 'government-integrated companies' that were dissolved after Japan's defeat.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「 」で括られた部分にシングル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 社名変更後のクレジット表記は星空の後に動く雲をバックに大映マークが映り、それにかぶさるように「作製社會式株映大」の文字がズーム→停止→落下するという演出であった。
sen.e: After the company name change, the opening credit in its films showed the Daiei logo with a starry night sky background, next zooming into the company name in Japanese (written in the old-style right-to-left direction) to overlap with the logo, and next stopping at the position and descending.

After the change in company name, the opening credits of its films showed the Daiei logo against a starry night sky, zooming into the company name in Japanese (written in the old-style right-to-left direction) to overlap the logo, stopping in position and then descending.

After the change in company name, the opening credits of its films showed the Daiei logo against a starry night sky, zooming into the phrase 'produced by Daiei Motion Pictures' in Japanese (written in the old-style right-to-left direction) to overlap the logo, stopping in position and then descending.
sen.cmt: 「作製社會式株映大」の「作製」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: 1950年頃まで使用されていた。
sen.e: This was used until around 1950.
This was used until around 1950.
This was used until around 1950.

sen.j: 1946年、専務の永田雅一が副社長に昇格。
sen.e: In 1946, executive managing director Masaichi NAGATA was promoted vice president.
In 1946, executive managing director Masaichi NAGATA was promoted to the position of vice president.
In 1946, executive managing director Masaichi NAGATA was promoted to the position of vice president.

sen.j: 永田時代
sen.e: Daiei under Nagata
Daiei under Nagata
Daiei under Nagata

sen.j: 1947年、菊池寛社長が文筆業専念のため退任。
sen.e: In 1947, President Kan KIKUCHI resigned to devote more time into writing.
In 1947, President Kan KIKUCHI resigned to devote more time to writing.
In 1947, President Kan KIKUCHI resigned to devote more time to writing.

sen.j: 副社長の永田雅一が社長に昇格。
sen.e: Vice president Masaichi NAGATA was promoted president.
Vice president Masaichi NAGATA was then promoted president.
Vice president Masaichi NAGATA was then promoted president.

sen.j: 人気作家の川口松太郎が専務に招かれる。
sen.e: Popular novelist Matsutaro KAWAGUCHI was invited to take office as senior managing director.
Popular novelist Matsutaro KAWAGUCHI was invited to take office as senior managing director.
Popular novelist Matsutaro KAWAGUCHI was invited to take office as senior managing director.

sen.j: 1948年、プロ野球団金星スターズを買収して「大映ユニオンズ」(高橋ユニオンズとの合併により大映ユニオンズにチーム名を変更した後千葉ロッテマリーンズと合併し大毎オリオンズとなる）を結成。
sen.e: In 1948, the professional baseball team Kinboshi Stars was purchased to organize Daiei Unions (so renamed on merger with Takahashi Unions and later becomes Daimai Orions with merger with Chiba Lotte Marines).
sen.cmt: 千葉ロッテマリーンズは、1990年代以降のチームですが？
sen.e: In 1948, the professional baseball team Kinboshi Stars was purchased to create Daiei Unions, which was so renamed following a merger with Takahashi Unions, later becoming Daimai Orions with the merger with Chiba Lotte Marines.

In 1948, the professional baseball team Kinboshi Stars was purchased to create 'Daiei Unions,' which was so renamed following a merger with Takahashi Unions, later becoming Daimai Orions with the merger with Chiba Lotte Marines.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「 」で括られた部分にシングル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 三益愛子主演の「母物シリーズ」が始まり10年続く大人気シリーズとなる。
sen.e: The "mother" series with Aiko MIMASU as leading actress becomes a very popular series lasting 10 years.
The "mother" series with Aiko MIMASU as leading actress became a very popular series lasting for ten years.
sen.cmt: Tense. Although in a list it is sometimes advisable to use the present tense to make the content more vivid, this is part of a large article and I think it is preferable to use the past tense.
sen.e: The 'mother series' with Aiko MIMASU as leading actress became a very popular series lasting for ten years.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「 」で括られた部分をシングル・クォーテーションに変更し、「シリーズ」までが、「 」で括られているので、'mother series' としました。

sen.j: 1951年、『羅生門 (映画)』（監督・黒澤明）がヴェネチア国際映画祭グランプリ受賞。
sen.e: In 1951, the film Rashomon (director, Akira KUROSAWA) wins the Grand Prix at the Venice International Film Festival.
In 1951, the film Rashomon (director, Akira KUROSAWA) won the Grand Prix at the Venice International Film Festival.
In 1951, the film "Rashomon" (directed by Akira KUROSAWA) won the Grand Prix at the Venice International Film Festival.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「監督・黒澤明」は、下記「原作・有吉佐和子」の表記（written by Sawako ARIYOSHI)に合わせました。

sen.j: 1953年、『雨月物語』（監督・溝口健二）がヴェネチア国際映画祭銀獅子賞受賞。
sen.e: In 1953, The Tale of Ugetsu (Ugetsu-monogatari; director, Kenji MIZOGUCHI) wins the Silver Lion Award at the Venice International Film Festival.
In 1953, The Tale of Ugetsu (Ugetsu-monogatari; director, Kenji MIZOGUCHI) won the Silver Lion Award at the Venice International Film Festival.
In 1953, the film "Ugetsu monogatari" (Tale of Rainy Moon; directed by Kenji MIZOGUCHI) won the Silver Lion Award at the Venice International Film Festival.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「監督・黒澤明」は、下記「原作・有吉佐和子」の表記（written by Sawako ARIYOSHI)に合わせました。また、上記に合わせ、the film "Ugetsu monogatari"とし、『雨月物語』の英訳は、用語集を参照し、変更しました。

sen.j: 1954年、『地獄門』（監督・衣笠貞之助）がカンヌ国際映画祭グランプリ受賞。
sen.e: In 1954, the film Jigokumon (Gates of Hell; director, Teinosuke KINUGASA) wins the Grand Prix at the Cannes International Film Festival.
Also, in 1954 the film Jigokumon (Gates of Hell; director, Teinosuke KINUGASA) won the Grand Prix at the Cannes International Film Festival.
Also, in 1954 the film "Jigokumon" (Gates of Hell; directed by Teinosuke KINUGASA) won the Grand Prix at the Cannes International Film Festival.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「監督・黒澤明」は、下記「原作・有吉佐和子」の表記（written by Sawako ARIYOSHI)に合わせました。

sen.j: たてつづけに『山椒太夫』（監督・溝口健二）ヴェネチア国際映画祭銀獅子賞受賞。
sen.e: In rapid succession, Sansho-dayu (director, Kenji MIZOGUCHI) wins the Silver Lion Award at the Venice International Film Festival.
Soon after, Sansho-dayu (director, Kenji MIZOGUCHI) won the Silver Lion Award at the Venice International Film Festival.
Soon after, the film "Sansho-dayu" (directed by Kenji MIZOGUCHI) won the Silver Lion Award at the Venice International Film Festival.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「監督・黒澤明」は、下記「原作・有吉佐和子」の表記（written by Sawako ARIYOSHI)に合わせました。また、上記に合わせ、the film "Ugetsu monogatari"としました。

sen.j: 1950年代から1960年代前半にかけて長谷川一夫を筆頭に三大女優の京マチ子・山本富士子・若尾文子、そして市川雷蔵 (8代目)、名作を多数送り出す。
sen.e: In the 1950s and the first half of 1960s, Daiei launched some of the top stars of Japan's motion picture history, led by Kazuo HASEGAWA and the three leading actresses Machiko KYO, Fujiko YAMAMOTO and Ayako WAKAO, as well as Raizo ICHIKAWA VIII, and produced a large number of films that are regarded classics, by introducing actors and actresses who either freelance or under contract with other film companies, such as Hideko TAKAMINE, Koji TSURUTA and Keiko KISHI.

In the 1950s and the first half of the 1960s, Daiei launched some of the top stars in Japanese motion picture history, led by Kazuo HASEGAWA and the three leading actresses Machiko KYO, Fujiko YAMAMOTO and Ayako WAKAO, as well as Raizo ICHIKAWA VIII.
sen.cmt: Long sentence split for clarity. Grammar.
sen.e: In the 1950s and the first half of the 1960s, Daiei produced a large number of films led by Kazuo HASEGAWA and the three leading actresses Machiko KYO, Fujiko YAMAMOTO and Ayako WAKAO, as well as Raizo ICHIKAWA VIII.
sen.cmt: 文章を分割したことにより、原文に即さなくなったため、変更しました。

sen.j: 日本映画史に残る大スター達を擁し、さらに他社専属やフリーの高峰秀子、鶴田浩二、岸惠子らも出演する。
sen.e: Daiei produced a large number of films that are regarded as classics, by introducing actors and actresses who were either freelance or under contract with other film companies, such as Hideko TAKAMINE, Koji TSURUTA and Keiko KISHI.
sen.cmt: Long sentence split for clarity. Grammar.
sen.e: Daiei held top starts in Japanese motion picture history, and also produced films in which actors and actresses who were either freelance or under contract with other film companies, such as Hideko TAKAMINE, Koji TSURUTA and Keiko KISHI, appeared.
sen.cmt: 文章を分割したことにより、原文に即さなくなったため、変更しました。

sen.j: 1960年代に入ると勝新太郎、田宮二郎が頭角を現す。
sen.e: In the 1960s, actors Shintaro KATSU and Jiro TAMIYA rise to stardom.
In the 1960s, actors Shintaro KATSU and Jiro TAMIYA rose to stardom.
In the 1960s, actors Shintaro KATSU and Jiro TAMIYA rose to stardom.

sen.j: 一方で台湾など海外との合作による大作や70ミリ映画「釈迦」「秦・始皇帝」（2作ともヒット）を制作するなど超大作路線を歩む。
sen.e: At the same time, Daiei pursued large-scale productions, such as joint productions with companies in Taiwan and other countries and 70mm film productions such as Shaka (Shakyamuni) and Shin no Shikoutei (Shi Hunagdi), both of which became box office hits.

At the same time, Daiei devoted itself to large-scale productions, such as joint productions with companies in Taiwan and other countries and 70mm film productions such as Shaka (Shakyamuni) and Shin no Shikoutei (Shi Hunagdi), both of which became box office hits.

At the same time, Daiei devoted itself to large-scale productions, such as joint productions with companies in Taiwan and other countries and 70mm film productions such as 'Shaka' (Shakyamuni) and 'Shin no Shikoutei' (Shi Hunagdi), both of which became box office hits.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「 」で括られた部分にシングル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: また、ウォルト・ディズニー作品の日本における配給権を握っていた。
sen.e: Daiei also held distributor rights to Walt Disney films in Japan.
Daiei also held the distribution rights to Walt Disney films in Japan.
Daiei also held the distribution rights to Walt Disney films in Japan.

sen.j: 1958年、社内に大映テレビ製作室を設けて、テレビ映画の製作に乗り出す。
sen.e: In 1958, Daiei created a television production office inside the company to start up TV movie production.
In 1958, Daiei created a television production office inside the company in order to begin TV movie production.
In 1958, Daiei created a television production office inside the company in order to begin TV movie production.

sen.j: 「大映スコープ」の導入によりクレジット表記が雲の果てから太陽の光が差し込むというお馴染みのものになる。
sen.e: With the introduction of Daiei Scope, the opening credit was changed to the familiar footage of sunlight shining through the clouds.
With the introduction of Daiei Scope the opening credits were changed back to the familiar footage of sunlight shining through the clouds.
With the introduction of 'Daiei Scope' the opening credits were changed back to the familiar footage of sunlight shining through the clouds.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「 」で括られた部分にシングル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 白黒・カラー共通で末期まで使用された。
sen.e: This was used for both monochrome and color productions, until Daiei's last years.
This was used for both monochrome and color productions, until Daiei's final years.
This was used for both monochrome and color productions, until Daiei's final years.

sen.j: 1959年、東宝、松竹、文化放送、ニッポン放送と共にフジテレビジョンを開局。
sen.e: In 1959, Fuji Television Network, Inc., was founded jointly by Daiei with Toho Co., Ltd., Shochiku Co., Ltd., Nippon Cultural Broadcasting, Inc., and Nippon Broadcasting System, Inc.
In 1959, the Fuji Television Network was founded jointly by Daiei along with Toho, Shochiku, Nippon Cultural Broadcasting, and Nippon Broadcasting System.
sen.cmt: Grammar. Companies are not usually referred to by their formal title. For example, Amazon is used to describe the internet-based company rather than Amazon Co. Ltd.
sen.e: In 1959, the Fuji Television Network was founded jointly by Daiei along with Toho, Shochiku, Nippon Cultural Broadcasting, and Nippon Broadcasting System.

sen.j: 1961年、現代劇のトップスター菅原謙二が退社。
sen.e: In 1961, Daiei's contemporary drama star Kenji SUGAWARA left the company.
In 1961, Daiei's the star of contemporary drama, Kenji SUGAWARA, left the company.
In 1961, Daiei's the star of contemporary drama, Kenji SUGAWARA, left the company.

sen.j: 1962年、東京都荒川区南千住にプロ野球専用球場・東京スタジアム (野球場)（東京球場）を建設。
sen.e: In 1962, Tokyo Stadium was built in Minami-Senju, Arakawa-ku, Tokyo, as a professional baseball stadium.
In 1962, Tokyo Stadium was built in Minami-Senju, Arakawa-ku, Tokyo, as a professional baseball stadium.
In 1962, Tokyo Stadium was built in Minamisenju, Arakawa Ward, Tokyo, as a professional baseball stadium.
sen.cmt: trans2 では、"OK"と表記されておりますが、用語集に従い、「荒川区南千住」の表記を変更しました。

sen.j: 現代劇で活躍していた人気若手スター・川口浩（川口松太郎の長男）が退社。
sen.e: The company's popular young actor Hiroshi KAWAGUCHI (son for Matsutaro KAWAGUCHI), who appeared in Daiei's period drama films, left the company.
Popular young actor Hiroshi KAWAGUCHI (the son of Matsutaro KAWAGUCHI), who appeared in Daiei's period drama films, left the company.
Popular young actor Hiroshi KAWAGUCHI (the first son of Matsutaro KAWAGUCHI), who appeared in Daiei's period drama films, left the company.
sen.cmt: 「長男」の訳を"first son"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1963年、戦前から日本を代表する二枚目であり、戦後の大映映画の大黒柱だった長谷川一夫が映画界から引退。
sen.e: In 1963, Kazuo HASEGAWA, Japan's foremost actor of the prewar period known for his outstanding good looks and the top Daiei star of the postwar period, retired from the motion picture industry.
In 1963, Kazuo HASEGAWA, Japan's foremost actor of the prewar period known for his outstanding good looks and being the top Daiei star of the postwar period, retired from the motion picture industry.
In 1963, Kazuo HASEGAWA, Japan's foremost actor of the prewar period known for his outstanding good looks and being the top Daiei star of the postwar period, retired from the motion picture industry.

sen.j: そして、日本一の美女と言われ、美人の代名詞であった看板女優・山本富士子が他社出演の許可と出演本数を少なくするという約束を守ってほしいと頼んだところ永田社長の怒りを買い、一方的に解雇され、五社協定にかけられ他社の映画や舞台にも出演できなくなる。
sen.e: In addition, Fujiko YAMAMOTO, a top actress who was known as the most beautiful woman in Japan, requested for permission to appear in films produced by other companies and to reduce the number of films required under contract and angered Daiei president Nagata, resulting in unilateral dismissal and ban on appearing in any film or theatrical production under the five-party agreement among the top film companies on management of film cast and crew.

In addition, Fujiko YAMAMOTO, a top actress who was known as the most beautiful woman in Japan, requested permission to appear in films produced by other companies and to reduce the number of films required under contract, angering Daiei president Nagata and resulting in her dismissal and a ban on appearing in any film or theatrical production under the five-party agreement among the top film companies regarding management of film cast and crew.

In addition, Fujiko YAMAMOTO, a top actress who was known as the most beautiful woman in Japan, requested permission to appear in films produced by other companies and to reduce the number of films required under contract, angering Daiei president Nagata and resulting in her dismissal and a ban on appearing in any film or theatrical production under the five-party agreement among the top film companies regarding management of film cast and crew.

sen.j: 以降、山本富士子は「山本富士子アワー」などのテレビドラマに主演して好評を得た後、舞台に進出し、五社協定が自然消滅した現在まで映画出演はしていない。
sen.e: Later, Fujiko YAMAMOTO gained popularity on television with drama series such as the Yamamoto Fujiko Hour and later appeared on theater but not motion pictures, even to this day when the agreement among the film companies has expired naturally and lost effect.

Later, Fujiko YAMAMOTO gained popularity on television with drama series such as the Yamamoto Fujiko Hour and later appeared at the theater, but she has not appeared in motion pictures even though the agreement among the film companies has expired.

Later, Fujiko YAMAMOTO gained popularity on television with drama series such as the 'Yamamoto Fujiko Hour' and later appeared at the theater, but she has not appeared in motion pictures even though the agreement among the film companies has expired.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「 」で括られた部分にシングル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 期待された叶順子 (女優)もこの年、引退。
sen.e: This year, the up-and-coming starlet Junko KANO also retired from the industry.
Also in this year, the up-and-coming starlet Junko KANO retired from the industry.
Also in this year, the up-and-coming starlet Junko KANO retired from the industry.

sen.j: こうして看板スターを相次いで失った大映の映画館は空席が目立つようになる。
sen.e: With top stars leaving the company in rapid succession, Daiei began to lose its movie-going fan base.
With top stars leaving the company in rapid succession, Daiei began to lose its movie-going fan base.
With top stars leaving the company in rapid succession, Daiei began to lose its movie-going fan base.

sen.j: 1965年、東宝の特撮企画に対抗して、東京撮影所で『大怪獣ガメラ』を製作、大ヒットとなる。
sen.e: In 1965, Daiei's Tokyo Movie Studio produced Daikaiju Gamera (Gamera) to compete against Toho's special effects productions, producing a big hit and demonstrating its special effects skills and building into a profit-making series until the company filed for bankruptcy.
In 1965, Daiei's Tokyo Movie Studio produced Daikaiju Gamera (Gamera) to compete against Toho's special effect-laden productions, and it became a big hit.
In 1965, Daiei's Tokyo Movie Studio produced "Daikaiju Gamera" (Gamera) to compete against Toho's special effect-laden productions, and it became a big hit.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 大映の特撮技術を内外に知らしめ、倒産までドル箱の人気シリーズとなった。
sen.e: This series demonstrated the company's ability to use special effects and was a profit-making series right up until the company finally filed for bankruptcy.
This series demonstrated the company's ability to use special effects and was a profit-making series right up until the company finally filed for bankruptcy.

sen.j: 子供を中心とした観客層は倒産まで安定した動員数を稼ぎ、末期の大映を支える柱のひとつとなった。
sen.e: Its fan base consisting chiefly of children provided a measure of stability in the number of moviegoers and a major source of earnings in its final years until its bankruptcy.
Its fan base, consisting chiefly of children, provided a measure of stability in the number of moviegoers and proved a major source of earnings in its final years.
Its fan base, consisting chiefly of children, provided a measure of stability in the number of moviegoers and proved a major source of earnings in its final years.

sen.j: 1967年、勝新太郎が石原プロ・三船プロなどのスターによる製作プロダクションブームに刺激され勝プロを設立。
sen.e: In 1967, Shintaro KATSU, motivated by other top stars setting up their own movie production companies, set up Katsu Production.
In 1967, Shintaro KATSU, motivated by other top stars setting up their own movie production companies, set up Katsu Productions.
In 1967, Shintaro KATSU, motivated by other top stars setting up their own movie production companies, set up Katsu Productions.

sen.j: 一方、大映は映画製作の赤字などによる巨額の負債が表面化。
sen.e: On the other hand, enormous debts incurred in motion picture production, etc., surfaced at Daiei.
However, in the mean time enormous debts incurred in motion picture production surfaced at Daiei.
However, in the mean time enormous debts incurred in motion picture production surfaced at Daiei.

sen.j: 1968年、看板俳優の田宮二郎が映画『不信のとき』（原作：有吉佐和子）に主演したが、クレジットが4番目であることを抗議すると激怒した永田社長により一方的に解雇され、五社協定にもかけられ他社の映画・テレビドラマにも出演できなくなる。
sen.e: In 1968, top star Jiro TAMIYA submitted a protest to Daiei for his name being listed 4th in the credits for the film Fushin no toki (When in Doubt; written by Sawako ARIYOSHI) and was summarily fired by Daiei's president Nagata, unable to make appearances in motion pictures or TV dramas under the five-party agreement among the film companies.

In 1968, top star Jiro TAMIYA submitted a protest to Daiei for his name being listed fourth in the credits for the film Fushin no Toki (When in Doubt; written by Sawako ARIYOSHI) and was summarily fired by Daiei's president Nagata, unable to make appearances in motion pictures or TV dramas under the five-party agreement among the film companies.

In 1968, top star Jiro TAMIYA submitted a protest to Daiei for his name being listed fourth in the credits for the film "Fushin no Toki" (When in Doubt; written by Sawako ARIYOSHI) in spite of leading actor and was summarily fired by Daiei's president Nagata, unable to make appearances in motion pictures or TV dramas under the five-party agreement among the film companies.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「主演した」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: しかしその後、田宮も1969年スタートのテレビ番組「クイズタイムショック」（NET、現・テレビ朝日系列）の司会で成功を収め長寿番組とし、大映倒産後の1970年代には映画界にも復帰。
sen.e: However, Tamiya won the post of emcee of a TV program titled Quiz Time Shock (aired by NET, presently TV Asahi network) starting in 1969, successfully making the program a long-running show and returning to the movies in the 1970s after Daiei went under.

However, Tamiya became the host of a TV program entitled Quiz Time Shock (aired by NET, presently the TV Asahi network) in 1969, successfully making the program a long-running show and only returning to movies in the 1970s after Daiei went under.

However, Tamiya became the host of a TV program entitled 'Quiz Time Shock' (aired by NET, presently the TV Asahi network) in 1969, successfully making the program a long-running show and only returning to movies in the 1970s after Daiei went under.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「 」で括られた部分にシングル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: また、テレビドラマでもシリーズを持ち、多数のヒット作を送り出した。
sen.e: He also appeared in various TV drama series, many of which became big hits.
He also appeared in various TV drama series, many of which became big hits.
He also appeared in various TV drama series, many of which became big hits.

sen.j: 日本映画黄金期を支えてきたスター・システムの崩壊と五社協定の弊害が明らかに。
sen.e: This marked the eventual collapse of the movie star system that built the golden age of the Japanese film industry and exposed the obstacles created by the film industry agreement.
This marked the eventual collapse of the movie star system that built the golden age of the Japanese film industry and exposed the obstacles created by the film industry agreement.
This marked the eventual collapse of the movie star system that built the golden age of the Japanese film industry and exposed the obstacles created by the film industry agreement.

sen.j: 同年、人気若手女優・姿美千子も退社。
sen.e: In the same year, a young but popular actress Michiko SUGATA left Daiei.
In the same year a young but popular actress Michiko SUGATA also left Daiei.
In the same year a young but popular actress Michiko SUGATA also left Daiei.

sen.j: 1969年、最後の頼みの綱だった看板俳優・市川雷蔵が37歳の若さで急逝。
sen.e: In 1969, Daiei's top actor and its last hope Raizo ICHIKAWA died young at the age of 37.
In 1969, Daiei's top actor and its last hope Raizo ICHIKAWA died young at the age of 37.
In 1969, Daiei's top actor and its last hope Raizo ICHIKAWA died young at the age of 37.

sen.j: 大黒柱の看板スター達を相次いで失い、大型の新人スターも輩出できず、映画産業全体の斜陽やテレビ界の発展にも圧され、大映映画の観客数の落ち込みがさらに深刻になる。
sen.e: With the loss of its top box office earners leaving in rapid succession, no big stars emerging and the motion picture industry itself losing its luster in face of dynamic growth of the TV industry, the decline in its moviegoing audience aggravated further.

With its top box office earners leaving in rapid succession, no big stars emerging to take their place, and the motion picture industry itself losing its luster in the face of the dynamic growth of the TV industry, the decline in its moviegoing audience was further exacerbated.

With its top box office earners leaving in rapid succession, no big stars emerging to take their place, and the motion picture industry itself losing its luster in the face of the dynamic growth of the TV industry, the decline in its moviegoing audience was further exacerbated.

sen.j: 1970年4月、同じく経営不振に喘いでいた日活と配給網を統合し、ダイニチ映配を設立。
sen.e: In April 1970, Daiei agreed to merge its film distribution network with Nikkatsu, also suffering from financial problems, and established Dainichi Eihai K.K.
In April 1970, Daiei agreed to merge its film distribution network with Nikkatsu, also suffering from financial problems, and established Dainichi Eihai K.K.
In April 1970, Daiei agreed to merge its film distribution network with Nikkatsu, also suffering from financial problems, and established Dainichi Eihai K.K.

sen.j: 旧来の撮影所システムの映画作りが無効になる中、暴力・エロ・グロを中心に企画を打ち出す。
sen.e: With the old-style movie production system losing effect, production plans began to center around violence, eroticism and the grotesque.
With the old-style movie production system losing its power production plans began to center around violence, eroticism and the grotesque.
With the old-style movie production system losing its power, production plans began to center around violence, eroticism and the grotesque.
sen.cmt: カンマが無いと読みにくいため、"losing its power"の後にカンマを付けました。

sen.j: 日活側は『野良猫ロック』『ネオン警察』『戦争と人間』シリーズなどを送り、大映側は「でんきくらげ」「十代の妊娠」「おさな妻」などの『ジュニア・セックス・シリーズ』、『高校生番長』シリーズなど若者を狙った映画のほか、勝プロなどによる佳作も配給した
sen.e: Nikkatsu created series such as Noraneko Rock (Stray Cat Rock), Neon Keisatsu (Neon Police) and Senso to Ningen (War and Man), while Daiei focused on the young audience with juvenile sex series such as Denki Kurage (Jellyfish), Judai no Ninshin (Teen Pregnancy) and Osana-zuma (Child Wife), as well as Kokosei Bancho (High School Gang Leader) series and smaller films produced by Katsu Production.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Nikkatsu created series such as Noraneko Rock (Stray Cat Rock), Neon Keisatsu (Neon Police) and Senso to Ningen (War and Man), while Daiei focused on a younger audience with series with a sexual theme such as Denki Kurage (Jellyfish), Judai no Ninshin (Teen Pregnancy) and Osana-zuma (Child Wife), as well as the Kokosei Bancho (High School Gang Leader) series and smaller films produced by Katsu Productions.

Nikkatsu created series such as "Noraneko Rock" (Stray Cat Rock), "Neon Keisatsu" (Neon Police) and "Senso to Ningen" (War and Man), while Daiei focused on a younger audience with series with a sexual theme such as "Denki Kurage" (Electric Jellyfish), "Judai no Ninshin" (Teen Pregnancy) and "Osana-zuma" (Child Wife), as well as the "Kokosei Bancho" (High School Gang Leader) series and smaller films produced by Katsu Productions.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「でんきくらげ」の「でんき」の部分の説明の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: だが、この弱者連合はすぐに行き詰まる。
sen.e: However, the coalition of the weak was quickly incapacitated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, this coalition of the weak soon had major difficulties.was quickly incapacitated.
However, this coalition of the weak soon had major difficulties.
sen.cmt: "was quickly incapcitated."の部分の削除がなされていなかったので、削除しました。

sen.j: 1971年8月、ダイニチ映配から日活が離脱。
sen.e: In August 1971, Nikkatsu split from Dainichi Eihai.
In August 1971, Nikkatsu split from Dainichi Eihai.
In August 1971, Nikkatsu split from Dainichi Eihai.

sen.j: 11月29日、全従業員に解雇通告がなされ、ついに大映倒産。
sen.e: On November 29, dismissal notices were sent to all Daiei employees, and the company collapsed.
On November 29, dismissal notices were sent to all Daiei employees, and the company went bankrupt.
On November 29, 1971, dismissal notices were sent to all Daiei employees, and the company went bankrupt.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、”年”を補いました。

sen.j: 直前に本社からの分離独立で大映テレビが発足し多数のスタッフが異動。
sen.e: Daiei TV that broke away from the parent company immediately before the collapse established itself as an independent company, with a large number of former Daiei staffers joining the company.
Daiei TV, which broke away from the parent company immediately before the collapse, established itself as an independent company with a large number of former Daiei staff joining the company.
Daiei TV, which broke away from the parent company immediately before the collapse, established itself as an independent company with a large number of former Daiei staff joining the company.

sen.j: 京都・太秦の大映京都撮影所を閉鎖。
sen.e: Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio in Uzumasa, Kyoto, was closed.
Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio in Uzumasa, Kyoto closed.
Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio in Uzumasa, Kyoto closed.

sen.j: 当面、労働組合が会社を管理し、経営の引き受け先を探すことになる。
sen.e: The company was to be run by its labor union for the time being, while search was conducted for new management.
The company was to be run by its labor union for the time being, while a search was conducted for new management.
The company was to be run by its labor union for the time being, while a search was conducted for new management.

sen.j: 1972年、テレビ時代劇『木枯し紋次郎』を制作協力していた大映京都撮影所所属の俳優とスタッフが中心となり、映像京都を設立。
sen.e: In 1972, the actors and production crew at the defunct Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio who collaborated in the production of the TV period drama Kogarashi Monjiro set up Eizo Kyoto Film Co.
In 1972, the actors and production crew at the defunct Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio who had collaborated in the production of the TV period drama Kogarashi Monjiro set up Eizo Kyoto Film Company.
In 1972, the actors and production crew at the defunct Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio who had collaborated in the production of the TV period drama "Kogarashi Monjiro" set up Eizo Kyoto Film Company.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 徳間時代
sen.e: Tokuma Period
Tokuma Period
Tokuma Period

sen.j: 1974年、労働組合は徳間康快率いる徳間書店と経営再建で合意。
sen.e: In 1974, the Daiei labor union concluded an agreement with Tokuma Shoten Publishing Co., Ltd., led by Yasuyoshi TOKUMA, on restructuring of the film company.
In 1974, the Daiei labor union concluded an agreement with Tokuma Shoten Publishing Company, led by Yasuyoshi TOKUMA, on the restructuring of the film company.
In 1974, the Daiei labor union concluded an agreement with Tokuma Shoten Publishing Co., Ltd., led by Yasuyoshi TOKUMA, on the restructuring of the film company.
sen.cmt: 「徳間書店」の表記を、用語集における表記に変更しました。

sen.j: 9月に新たな法人を設立し徳間の傘下の映画制作子会社となる。
sen.e: A new business organization was established in September and became a motion picture production subsidiary of Tokuma Shoten.
A new business organization was established in September and this became a motion picture production subsidiary of Tokuma Shoten.
A new business organization was established in September 1974, and this became a motion picture production subsidiary of Tokuma Shoten.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、”年”を補いました。

sen.j: 大映京都撮影所は大映映画撮影所（貸しスタジオ）となるなど、土地資産の売却や人材のリストラで負債を減らしていった。
sen.e: Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio also managed to slash its debts by turning into a rental studio, selling real estate it owned and streamlining its work force.
Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio also managed to slash its debts by turning into a rental studio, selling real estate it owned and streamlining its work force.
Daiei Kyoto Movie Studio also managed to slash its debts by turning into a rental studio, selling real estate it owned and streamlining its work force.

sen.j: また徳間書店の出版する小説の映画化（西村寿行の『君よ噴怒の河を渉れ』『黄金の犬』など）も始まる。
sen.e: This also marked the start of film production based on books published by Tokuma Shoten (such as Kimi yo Funnu no Kawa wo Watare and Ogon no Inu by Juko NISHIMURA).
This also marked the start of film production based on books published by Tokuma Shoten (such as Kimi yo Funnu no Kawa wo Watare and Ogon no Inu by Juko NISHIMURA).
This also marked the start of film production based on books published by Tokuma Shoten (such as "Kimi yo Funnu no Kawa wo Watare" and "Ogon no Inu" by Juko NISHIMURA).
sen.cmt: trans2 では、"OK"と表記されておりますが、指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 1982年、国交10周年を記念した日中合作映画『未完の対局』公開。
sen.e: In 1982, the Sino-Japanese joint production Mikan no Taikyoku, which commemorated the 10th anniversary of restoration of diplomatic ties between the two countries, was premiered.
In 1982, the Sino-Japanese joint production Mikan no Taikyoku, which commemorated the tenth anniversary of the restoration of diplomatic ties between the two countries, was premiered.
In 1982, the Sino-Japanese joint production "Mikan no Taikyoku," which commemorated the 10th anniversary of the restoration of diplomatic ties between the two countries, was premiered.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「10」をアラビア数字表記に変更しました。

sen.j: 永田大作路線に続く、徳間大作路線の始まり。
sen.e: The film marked the start of Tokuma's large-scale film productions, in the line of the production approach taken in the past by Masaichi NAGATA.
The film marked the start of Tokuma's large-scale film productions, in the vein of the production approach taken in the past by Masaichi NAGATA.
The film marked the start of Tokuma's large-scale film productions, in the vein of the production approach taken in the past by Masaichi NAGATA.

sen.j: 1986年、京都・太秦の大映映画撮影所を完全閉鎖し、跡地を売却。
sen.e: In 1986, the Daiei Movie Studio in Uzumasa, Kyoto, was shut down and the property sold.
In 1986, the Daiei Movie Studio in Uzumasa, Kyoto, was shut down and the property sold.
In 1986, the Daiei Movie Studio in Uzumasa, Kyoto, was shut down and the property sold.

sen.j: （現在の太秦中学校敷地ほか）
sen.e: (Uzumasa Junior High School and others stand on the land today.)
Uzumasa Junior High School stands on part of the area today.
Uzumasa Junior High School and others stand on part of the area today.
sen.cmt: 「ほか」に当る訳が削除されていたので、補いました。

sen.j: 1988年、前年のSF大作『首都消失』に続き、日中合作の超大作映画『敦煌 (映画)』公開。
sen.e: Following the science-fiction film Shuto Soshitsu in 1987, the Sino-Japanese mega-production Tonko was released in the next year.
Following the science-fiction film Shuto Soshitsu in 1987, the Sino-Japanese mega-production Tonko was released the following year.
Following the science-fiction film "Shuto Soshitsu" in 1987, the Sino-Japanese mega-production "Tonko" was released in 1988.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記し、「1988年」と原文で表記されているので、the following year を in 1988 に変更しました。

sen.j: 史上最大の45億円を投じた。
sen.e: The film cost an all-time high of 4.5 billion yen to produce.
The film cost an all-time high of 4.5 billion yen to produce.
The film cost an all-time high of 4.5 billion yen to produce.

sen.j: 1992年、25億円を投じソビエト連邦解体の激動のロシアで撮影した『おろしや国酔夢譚』公開。
sen.e: In 1992, the film titled Oroshia Kokusui Mutan was shot in Russia amid the turmoil of the dissolution of the Soviet Union, at the cost of 2.5 billion yen.
In 1992, the film entitled Oroshia Kokusui Mutan was shot in Russia amid the turmoil of the dissolution of the Soviet Union, at the cost of 2.5 billion yen.
In 1992, the film entitled "Oroshia Kokusui Mutan" was shot in Russia amid the turmoil of the dissolution of the Soviet Union, at the cost of 2.5 billion yen.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: これら超大作路線による借入金の増大とバブル崩壊などにより、大映のみならず徳間書店グループ自体の累積赤字が膨らんだ。
sen.e: Debts from these mega-productions combined with collapse of Japan's economic bubble to generate cumulative losses not only for Daiei but for the entire Tokuma Shoten Group as well.
Debts from these mega-productions combined with the collapse of Japan's economic bubble resulted in cumulative losses not only for Daiei but for the entire Tokuma Shoten Group as well.
Debts from these mega-productions combined with the collapse of Japan's economic bubble resulted in cumulative losses not only for Daiei but for the entire Tokuma Shoten Group as well.

sen.j: 『ガメラ』シリーズ、『Shall we ダンス?』など佳作にも果敢に投資しヒットさせたが、徳間書店は住友銀行の管理下におかれることとなり、大映の売却も話題に上る。
sen.e: Despite successes in smaller quality films such as Shall We Dance? and the Gamera series, Tokuma Shoten went under management of Sumitomo Bank, and rumors rose of Daiei's sale.
Despite successes in smaller quality films such as Shall We Dance? and the Gamera series, Tokuma Shoten fell under the management of Sumitomo Bank, and rumors rose of Daiei's sale.
Despite successes in smaller quality films such as "Shall We Dance?" and the "Gamera" series, Tokuma Shoten fell under the management of Sumitomo Bank, and rumors rose of Daiei's sale.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、『 』で括られた部分にダブル・クォーテーションを付記しました。

sen.j: 2000年、徳間康快死去。
sen.e: Yasuyoshi Tokuma dies in 2000.
Yasuyoshi Tokuma died in 2000.
Yasuyoshi TOKUMA died in 2000.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、氏名の表記を変更しました。

sen.j: 2002年7月、角川書店は徳間書店から、大映が保有する映画、ビデオ製作、配給、調布市の大映スタジオ（多摩川撮影所）の運営などの全事業を取得することで合意。
sen.e: In July 2002, Kadokawa Shoten concluded an agreement with Tokuma Shoten to take over Daiei's entire business operation, including motion picture and video production, distribution, and management of the Daiei Studio in Chofu.

In July 2002, Kadokawa Shoten concluded an agreement with Tokuma Shoten to take over Daiei's entire business operations, including motion picture and video production, distribution, and management of the Daiei Studio in Chofu.

In July 2002, Kadokawa Shoten concluded an agreement with Tokuma Shoten to take over Daiei's entire business operations, including motion picture and video production, distribution, and management of the Daiei Studio (Tamagawa Movie Studio) in Chofu.
sen.cmt: 「多摩川撮影所」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: 11月、角川の映像子会社「株式会社角川大映映画」が設立され、大映は営業権のすべてと従業員を譲渡して60年の歴史に幕を下ろした。
sen.e: In November, Kadokawa Daiei Motion Picture Co., Ltd., was established, with all business rights and work force for Daiei transferred to the new company, and marked the end of Daiei's 60-year history in filmmaking.

In November, Kadokawa Daiei Motion Pictures was established, with all business rights and the workforce at Daiei transferred to the new company, and marked the end of Daiei's sixty-year history in filmmaking.

In November 2002, 'Kadokawa Daiei Motion Pictures' was established, with all business rights and the workforce at Daiei transferred to the new company, and marked the end of Daiei's 60-year history in filmmaking.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、”年”を補い、「 」で括られた部分にシングル・クォーテーションを付記し、また、「60」をアラビア数字表記に戻しました。

sen.j: 法人は2003年1月に解散、2007年4月に清算結了している。
sen.e: The company was dissolved in January 2003 and completed liquidation in April 2007.
The company was dissolved in January 2003 and liquidation was completed in April 2007.
The company was dissolved in January 2003 and liquidation was completed in April 2007.

sen.j: なお、この時代に大映は、東光徳間（徳間書店東光徳間事業本部）と共同で中国映画・韓国映画の配給・提供なども手掛けた。
sen.e: During this period, Daiei had been involved in distribution of Chinese and Korean films in conjunction with Toko Tokuma (Toko Tokuma business division of Tokuma Shoten).
During this period, Daiei had been involved in the distribution of Chinese and Korean films in conjunction with Toko Tokuma (the Toko Tokuma business division of Tokuma Shoten).
During this period, Daiei had been involved in the distribution of Chinese and Korean films in conjunction with Toko Tokuma (the Toko Tokuma business division of Tokuma Shoten).

sen.j: 消滅後
sen.e: After liquidation
After liquidation
After liquidation

sen.j: 2004年、角川大映映画は角川の他の映像子会社と再編のため合併。
sen.e: In 2004, Kadokawa Daiei Motion Picture was merged with Kadokawa's other video subsidiaries.
In 2004, Kadokawa Daiei Motion Pictures was merged with Kadokawa's other video subsidiaries.
In 2004, Kadokawa Daiei Motion Pictures was merged with Kadokawa's other video subsidiaries for reorganization.
sen.cmt: 「再編のため」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました。

sen.j: 角川映画株式会社となり、大映スタジオ（多摩川撮影所）も、角川大映撮影所に改称した。
sen.e: It was renamed Kadokawa Picture, Inc., with the change, and the Daiei Studio (Tamagawa Studio) was renamed Kadokawa Daiei Movie Studio.
It was renamed Kadokawa Pictures following the change, and the Daiei Studio (Tamagawa Studio) was renamed Kadokawa Daiei Movie Studio.
It was renamed Kadokawa Pictures following the change, and the Daiei Studio (Tamagawa Movie Studio) was renamed Kadokawa Daiei Movie Studio.
sen.cmt: 「多摩川撮影所」の訳を、上記の表記に合わせるため、変更しました。

sen.j: 2006年3月、 角川ヘラルド・ピクチャーズと合併して、角川ヘラルド映画となった。
sen.e: With the merger of the company with Kadokawa Herald Pictures in March 2006, the company became Kadokawa Herald Eiga.
With the merger of the company with Kadokawa Herald Pictures in March 2006, the company became Kadokawa Herald Eiga.
With the merger of the company with Kadokawa Herald Pictures in March 2006, the company became Kadokawa Herald Eiga.

sen.j: 2007年3月、 社名を再び角川映画 (企業)に変更。
sen.e: In March 2007, the company was again renamed Kadokawa Pictures.
In March 2007, the company was again renamed Kadokawa Pictures.
In March 2007, the company was again renamed Kadokawa Pictures.
